text: Create your dough by mixing the baking powder, sugar, flour, salt, and cocoa in a bowl.  Double boil the chocolate. Heat a saucepan filled about 1/3 full with water. Bring the water to a simmer and place a bowl in the saucepan. Add the chocolate and butter in the bowl and stir & melt both ingredients. Remove the bowl from the heat. Add an egg to the chocolate mixture and use a whisk to stir. Measure and pour the vanilla essence to the bowl. Stir again. Carefully pour the chocolate mixture into the dry ingredient bowl. Fold and mix everything together. Cover the bowl with cling film and place it in the refrigerator for about an hour and a half. Pre-heat the oven to 325 degrees F, 170 degrees C, or gas mark 3.  Create balls from the dough and dip them into the icing sugar. Place the finished dough balls onto the baking tray. Bake the cookies for 15 minutes. When they come out of the oven, sprinkle some more icing sugar on them. Let them cool on a cooling rack.
